t: Micah 1
Destruction in Israel and Judah
The*p word of the Lord*s which came to*i Micah of Moresheth in the days of Jotham, Ahaz and*i Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
Hear,*pn O peoples, all of you; Listen,*ln O earth and all it contains, And*ln let the Lord God*s be a witness against you, The*ln Lord from His holy temple.
For*ln behold, the Lord*s is coming forth from His place. He*ln will come down and tread on the high places of the earth.
The*ln mountains will melt under Him And*ln the valleys will be split, Like*ln wax before the fire, Like*ln water poured down a steep place.

All*ln this is for the rebellion of Jacob And*ln for the sins of the house of Israel. What*ln is the rebellion of Jacob? Is*ln it not Samaria? What*ln is the high place of Judah? Is*ln it not Jerusalem?
For*ln I will make Samaria a heap of ruins in the open country, Planting*ln places for a vineyard. I*ln will pour her stones down into the valley And*ln will lay bare her foundations.

All*ln of her idols will be smashed, All*ln of her earnings will be burned with fire And*ln all of her images I will make desolate, For*ln she collected them*i from a harlot’s earnings, And*ln to the earnings of a harlot they will return.
Because*ln of this I must lament and wail, I*ln must go barefoot and naked; I*ln must make a lament like the jackals And*ln a mourning like the ostriches.
For*ln her wound is incurable, For*ln it has come to Judah; It*ln has reached the gate of my people, Even*iln to Jerusalem.
Tell*ln it not in Gath, Weep*ln not at all. At*ln Beth-le-aphrah roll yourself in the dust.
Go*ln on your way, inhabitant of Shaphir, in shameful nakedness. The*ln inhabitant of Zaanan does not escape. The*ln lamentation of Beth-ezel: “He will take from you its support.”
For*ln the inhabitant of Maroth Becomes*ln weak waiting for good, Because*ln a calamity has come down from the Lord*s To*ln the gate of Jerusalem.
Harness*ln the chariot to the team of horses, O*ln inhabitant of Lachish— She*ln was the beginning of sin To*ln the daughter of Zion— Because*ln in you were found The*ln rebellious acts of Israel.
Therefore*ln you will give parting gifts On*ln behalf of Moresheth-gath; The*ln houses of Achzib will*i become a deception To*ln the kings of Israel.
Moreover,*ln I will bring on you The*ln one who takes possession, O*ln inhabitant of Mareshah. The*ln glory of Israel will enter Adullam.
Make*ln yourself bald and cut off your hair, Because*ln of the children of your delight; Extend*ln your baldness like the eagle, For*ln they will go from you into exile.
Micah 2
Woe to Oppressors
Woe*pn to those who scheme iniquity, Who*ln work out evil on their beds! When*ln morning comes, they do it, For*ln it is in the power of their hands.
They*ln covet fields and then seize them,*i And*ln houses, and take them*i away. They*ln rob a man and his house, A*ln man and his inheritance.

Therefore*p thus says the Lord,*s “Behold,*pn I am planning against this family a calamity From*ln which you cannot remove your necks; And*ln you will not walk haughtily, For*ln it will be an evil time.

On*ln that day they will take up against you a taunt And*ln utter a bitter lamentation and*i say, ‘We*ln are completely destroyed! He*ln exchanges the portion of my people; How*ln He removes it from me! To*ln the apostate He apportions our fields.’
Therefore*ln you will have no one stretching a measuring line For*ln you by lot in the assembly of the Lord.*s
‘Do*ln not speak out,’ so*i they speak out. But*iln if*i they do not speak out concerning these things, Reproaches*ln will not be turned back.
Is*ln it being said, O house of Jacob: ‘Is*ln the Spirit of the Lord*s impatient? Are*ln these His doings?’ Do*ln not My words do good To*ln the one walking uprightly?
Recently*ln My people have arisen as an enemy— You*ln strip the robe off the garment From*ln unsuspecting passers-by, From*iln those returned from war.
The*ln women of My people you evict, Each*ln one*i from her pleasant house. From*ln her children you take My splendor forever.
Arise*ln and go, For*ln this is no place of rest Because*ln of the uncleanness that brings on destruction, A*ln painful destruction.
If*ln a man walking after wind and falsehood Had*ln told lies and*i said,*i ‘I*ln will speak out to you concerning wine and liquor,’ He*ln would be spokesman to this people.

“I*ln will surely assemble all of you, Jacob, I*ln will surely gather the remnant of Israel. I*ln will put them together like sheep in the fold; Like*ln a flock in the midst of its pasture They*ln will be noisy with men.
The*ln breaker goes up before them; They*ln break out, pass through the gate and go out by it. So*ln their king goes on before them, And*ln the Lord*s at their head.”
Micah 3
Rulers Denounced
And*p I said, “Hear*pn now, heads of Jacob And*ln rulers of the house of Israel. Is*ln it not for you to know justice?
You*ln who hate good and love evil, Who*ln tear off their skin from them And*ln their flesh from their bones,
Who*ln eat the flesh of my people, Strip*ln off their skin from them, Break*ln their bones And*ln chop them*i up as for the pot And*ln as meat in a kettle.”
Then*ln they will cry out to the Lord,*s But*ln He will not answer them. Instead,*ln He will hide His face from them at that time Because*ln they have practiced evil deeds.

Thus*p says the Lord*s concerning the prophets who lead my people astray; When*pn they have something*i to bite with their teeth, They*ln cry, “Peace,” But*ln against him who puts nothing in their mouths They*ln declare holy war.
Therefore*ln it*i will*i be*i night for you—without vision, And*ln darkness for you—without divination. The*ln sun will go down on the prophets, And*ln the day will become dark over them.
The*ln seers will be ashamed And*ln the diviners will be embarrassed. Indeed,*ln they will all cover their*i mouths Because*ln there is no answer from God.
On*ln the other hand I am filled with power— With*ln the Spirit of the Lord—*s And*ln with justice and courage To*ln make known to Jacob his rebellious act, Even*ln to Israel his sin.
Now*ln hear this, heads of the house of Jacob And*ln rulers of the house of Israel, Who*ln abhor justice And*ln twist everything that is straight,
Who*ln build Zion with bloodshed And*ln Jerusalem with violent injustice.

Her*ln leaders pronounce judgment for a bribe, Her*ln priests instruct for a price And*ln her prophets divine for money. Yet*ln they lean on the Lord*s saying, “Is*ln not the Lord*s in our midst? Calamity*ln will not come upon us.”
Therefore,*ln on account of you Zion*ln will be plowed as a field, Jerusalem*ln will become a heap of ruins, And*ln the mountain of the temple will*i become*i high places of a forest.
Micah 4
Peaceful Latter Days

And*pn it will come about in the last days That*ln the mountain of the house of the Lord*s Will*ln be established as the chief of the mountains. It*ln will be raised above the hills, And*ln the peoples will stream to it.

Many*ln nations will come and say, “Come*ln and let us go up to the mountain of the Lord*s And*ln to the house of the God of Jacob, That*ln He may teach us about His ways And*ln that we may walk in His paths.” For*ln from Zion will go forth the law, Even*ln the word of the Lord*s from Jerusalem.

And*ln He will judge between many peoples And*ln render decisions for mighty, distant nations. Then*ln they will hammer their swords into plowshares And*ln their spears into pruning hooks; Nation*ln will not lift up sword against nation, And*ln never again will they train for war.
Each*ln of them will sit under his vine And*ln under his fig tree, With*ln no one to make them*i afraid, For*ln the mouth of the Lord*s of hosts has spoken.
Though*ln all the peoples walk Each*ln in the name of his god, As*ln for us, we will walk In*ln the name of the Lord*s our God forever and ever.
“In*ln that day,” declares the Lord,*s “I*ln will assemble the lame And*ln gather the outcasts, Even*ln those whom I have afflicted.
I*ln will make the lame a remnant And*ln the outcasts a strong nation, And*ln the Lord*s will reign over them in Mount Zion From*ln now on and forever.
As*ln for you, tower of the flock, Hill*ln of the daughter of Zion, To*ln you it will come— Even*ln the former dominion will come, The*ln kingdom of the daughter of Jerusalem.
“Now,*ln why do you cry out loudly? Is*ln there no king among you, Or*ln has your counselor perished, That*ln agony has gripped you like a woman in childbirth?

Writhe*ln and labor to give birth, Daughter*ln of Zion, Like*ln a woman in childbirth; For*ln now you will go out of the city, Dwell*ln in the field, And*ln go to Babylon. There*ln you will be rescued; There*ln the Lord*s will redeem you From*ln the hand of your enemies.
And*ln now many nations have been assembled against you Who*ln say, ‘Let her be polluted, And*ln let our eyes gloat over Zion.’
But*ln they do not know the thoughts of the Lord,*s And*ln they do not understand His purpose; For*ln He has gathered them like sheaves to the threshing floor.

Arise*ln and thresh, daughter of Zion, For*ln your horn I will make iron And*ln your hoofs I will make bronze, That*ln you may pulverize many peoples, That*ln you may devote to the Lord*s their unjust gain And*ln their wealth to the Lord of all the earth.
Micah 5
Birth of the King in Bethlehem
“Now*pn muster yourselves in troops, daughter of troops; They*ln have laid siege against us; With*ln a rod they will smite the judge of Israel on the cheek.

But*ln as for you, Bethlehem Ephrathah, Too*iln little to be among the clans of Judah, From*ln you One will go forth for Me to be ruler in Israel. His*ln goings forth are from long ago, From*ln the days of eternity.”
Therefore*ln He will give them up*i until the time When*ln she who is in labor has borne a child. Then*ln the remainder of His brethren Will*ln return to the sons of Israel.

And*ln He will arise and shepherd His*i flock*i In*ln the strength of the Lord,*s In*ln the majesty of the name of the Lord*s His God. And*ln they will remain, Because*ln at that time He will be great To*ln the ends of the earth.
This*ln One will be our*i peace. When*bln the Assyrian invades our land, When*ln he tramples on our citadels, Then*ln we will raise against him Seven*ln shepherds and eight leaders of men.

They*ln will shepherd the land of Assyria with the sword, The*ln land of Nimrod at its entrances; And*ln He will deliver us*i from the Assyrian When*ln he attacks our land And*ln when he tramples our territory.
Then*ln the remnant of Jacob Will*ln be among many peoples Like*ln dew from the Lord,*s Like*ln showers on vegetation Which*ln do not wait for man Or*ln delay for the sons of men.

The*ln remnant of Jacob Will*ln be among the nations, Among*ln many peoples Like*ln a lion among the beasts of the forest, Like*ln a young lion among flocks of sheep, Which,*ln if he passes through, Tramples*ln down and tears, And*ln there is none to rescue.
Your*ln hand will be lifted up against your adversaries, And*ln all your enemies will be cut off.
“It*ln will be in that day,” declares the Lord,*s “That*ln I will cut off your horses from among you And*ln destroy your chariots.
I*ln will also cut off the cities of your land And*ln tear down all your fortifications.
I*ln will cut off sorceries from your hand, And*ln you will have fortune-tellers no more.
I*ln will cut off your carved images And*ln your sacred*i pillars from among you, So*ln that you will no longer bow down To*ln the work of your hands.
I*ln will root out your Asherim from among you And*ln destroy your cities.
And*ln I will execute vengeance in anger and wrath On*ln the nations which have not obeyed.”
Micah 6
God’s Indictment of His People
Hear*pn now what the Lord*s is saying, “Arise,*ln plead your case before the mountains, And*ln let the hills hear your voice.
Listen,*ln you mountains, to the indictment of the Lord,*s And*ln you enduring foundations of the earth, Because*ln the Lord*s has a case against His people; Even*ln with Israel He will dispute.
My*ln people, what have I done to you, And*ln how have I wearied you? Answer Me.
Indeed,*ln I brought you up from the land of Egypt And*ln ransomed you from the house of slavery, And*ln I sent before you Moses, Aaron and Miriam.

My*ln people, remember now What*ln Balak king of Moab counseled And*ln what Balaam son of Beor answered him, And*iln from Shittim to Gilgal, So*ln that you might know the righteous acts of the Lord.”*s
What God Requires of Man
With*pn what shall I come to the Lord*s And*iln bow myself before the God on high? Shall*ln I come to Him with burnt offerings, With*ln yearling calves?
Does*ln the Lord*s take delight in thousands of rams, In*ln ten thousand rivers of oil? Shall*ln I present my firstborn for*i my rebellious acts, The*ln fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
He*ln has told you, O man, what is good; And*ln what does the Lord*s require of you But*ln to do justice, to love kindness, And*ln to walk humbly with your God?
The*ln voice of the Lord*s will call to the city— And*ln it is sound wisdom to fear Your name: “Hear,*ln O tribe. Who has appointed its time?
Is*ln there yet a man in the wicked house, Along*iln with*i treasures of wickedness And*ln a short measure that*i is*i cursed?
Can*ln I justify wicked scales And*ln a bag of deceptive weights?
For*ln the rich men of the*i city are full of violence, Her*ln residents speak lies, And*ln their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
So*ln also I will make you*i sick, striking you down, Desolating*ln you*i because of your sins.

You*ln will eat, but you will not be satisfied, And*ln your vileness will be in your midst. You*ln will try*i to*i remove for*i safekeeping,*i But*ln you will not preserve anything,*i And*ln what you do preserve I will give to the sword.
You*ln will sow but you will not reap. You*ln will tread the olive but will not anoint yourself with oil; And*ln the grapes, but you will not drink wine.

The*ln statutes of Omri And*ln all the works of the house of Ahab are observed; And*ln in their devices you walk. Therefore*ln I will give you up for destruction And*ln your inhabitants for derision, And*ln you will bear the reproach of My people.”
Micah 7
The Prophet Acknowledges
Woe*pn is me! For I am Like*ln the fruit pickers, like the grape gatherers. There*ln is not a cluster of grapes to eat, Or*iln a first-ripe fig which*i I crave.
The*ln godly person has perished from the land, And*ln there is no upright person*i among men. All*ln of them lie in wait for bloodshed; Each*ln of them hunts the other with a net.
Concerning*ln evil, both hands do it well. The*ln prince asks, also the judge, for a bribe, And*ln a great man speaks the desire of his soul; So*ln they weave it together.
The*ln best of them is like a briar, The*ln most upright like a thorn hedge. The*ln day when you post your watchmen, Your*ln punishment will come. Then*ln their confusion will occur.
Do*ln not trust in a neighbor; Do*ln not have confidence in a friend. From*ln her who lies in your bosom Guard*ln your lips.
For*ln son treats father contemptuously, Daughter*ln rises up against her mother, Daughter-in-law*ln against her mother-in-law; A*ln man’s enemies are the men of his own household.
God Is the Source of Salvation and Light
But*pn as for me, I will watch expectantly for the Lord;*s I*ln will wait for the God of my salvation. My*ln God will hear me.
Do*ln not rejoice over me, O my enemy. Though*ln I fall I will rise; Though*ln I dwell in darkness, the Lord*s is a light for me.

I*ln will bear the indignation of the Lord*s Because*ln I have sinned against Him, Until*ln He pleads my case and executes justice for me. He*ln will bring me out to the light, And*iln I will see His righteousness.

Then*ln my enemy will see, And*ln shame will cover her who said to me, “Where*ln is the Lord*s your God?” My*ln eyes will look on her; At*ln that time she will be trampled down Like*ln mire of the streets.
It*iln will*i be*i a day for building your walls. On*ln that day will your boundary be extended.
It*ln will*i be*i a day when they will come to you From*ln Assyria and the cities of Egypt, From*ln Egypt even to the Euphrates, Even*ln from sea to sea and mountain to mountain.
And*ln the earth will become desolate because of her inhabitants, On*ln account of the fruit of their deeds.

Shepherd*ln Your people with Your scepter, The*ln flock of Your possession Which*ln dwells by itself in the woodland, In*ln the midst of a fruitful field. Let*ln them feed in Bashan and Gilead As*ln in the days of old.
“As*ln in the days when you came out from the land of Egypt, I*ln will show you miracles.”
Nations*ln will see and be ashamed Of*ln all their might. They*ln will put their*i hand on their*i mouth, Their*ln ears will be deaf.

They*ln will lick the dust like a serpent, Like*ln reptiles of the earth. They*ln will come trembling out of their fortresses; To*ln the Lord*s our God they will come in dread And*ln they will be afraid before You.

Who*ln is a God like You, who pardons iniquity And*ln passes over the rebellious act of the remnant of His possession? He*ln does not retain His anger forever, Because*ln He delights in unchanging love.
He*ln will again have compassion on us; He*ln will tread our iniquities under foot. Yes,*ln You will cast all their sins Into*ln the depths of the sea.
You*ln will give truth to Jacob And*iln unchanging love to Abraham, Which*ln You swore to our forefathers From*ln the days of old.
